intro: Dubyaea melastomoides, commonly known as the rock melastome, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its small, opposite leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a compact, mat-forming growth habit, which helps it conserve moisture in its dry habitat. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae, which is known for its diverse array of tropical and subtropical species. Dubyaea melastomoides is adapted to rocky soils and can thrive in full sun, making it a resilient plant in harsh environments.
